JOHN ERNEST KRATZ III

Postdoctoral Fellow in data publication
at the California Digital Library.

  • Tell Me More

As this is my twentieth freebie for HTML5 UP
I decided to give it a really creative name.

Turns out Twenty was the best I could come up with. Anyway, lame name aside,
it's minimally designed, fully responsive, built on HTML5/CSS3/skel, and, like all my stuff,
released for free under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license. Have fun!

Projects and Publications

Data Publication Consensus and Controversies

An overview of data publication initiatives underway and the current conversation, highlighting points of consensus and issues still in contention.

Researcher Perceptions of Data Publication and Peer Review

Making Data Count

A collaboration between the California Digital Library, PLOS, and DataONE to develop Dataset-Level Metrics (DLMs) to assess data use and impact.

Awards and Education

RDA/US Fellowship


RDA/US Fellows receive travel funding to attend three consecutive plenaries and to present or discuss a topic of research, outreach, or education that they work on or plan to carry out in the nearest future.

CLIR/DLF Postdoctoral Fellowship

These two-year fellowships, partially supported by a grant from the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation, provide recent Ph.D.s with professional development, education, and training opportunities in data curation for the sciences and social sciences.

Ph.D., Columbia University

Awarded by the Department of Biological Sciences for work on C. elegans neurobiology and genetics.
